alert.note: Alert for Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 11:54PM EDT until April 06 at 6:49PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Cayuga and Onondaga. * WHEN...Until 145 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1154 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area, especially in areas with poor drainage, and areas which received heavy rainfall earlier tonight. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Syracuse, Auburn, Pompey, Manlius, Owasco, Sennett, Fleming, Otisco, Skaneateles, Genoa, Ledyard, Marcellus, Moravia, Camillus, Union Springs, Niles, Sempronius, Tully, Aurora and Lyndon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
